location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from James Dow, Assistant Surgeon, Temporarily in Charge of the Residency, Bushire, to Henry Willock, His Britannic Majesty's Chargé d’Affaires at the Court of Persia

mods.abstract: In this letter, James Dow, Assistant Surgeon, temporarily in charge of the Residency, informs Henry Willock, Chargé d’Affaires at the Court of Persia, that he has received charge of a steam engine, which was forwarded to Bushire by the Government of Bombay. Dow states that the engine, which consists of twelve packages, had been received from England from Sir Gore Ouseley for His Royal Highness, the Prince Royal of Persia. Dow states that he has been directed by the Government in India to contact Willock regarding the conveyance of the engine to Tehran.
